title: Customer Insights Representative - EMEA Enterprise
description:
Our vision is to transform presentations, meetings and lectures by turning passive audiences into engaged contributors. We make this possible through our interactive presentation platform where the traditional presentation monologue becomes an inclusive dialogue. We believe in the power of together and that the most successful leaders listen to be heard.
   

  

 With Mentimeter, users become the best presenter they can be. Meetings become more productive, participants learn more and have fun whilst doing it.
   

  

 We have more than 300 million users and customers worldwide, on our way of making the world a better place, one presentation at a time.
   

  

 We are looking for a
 **Customer** 
**Insights** 
**Representative** 
 to join our enterprise support team at our Stockholm office.
   

  

 You will join a humble and fast-moving team that helps our users look like superstars when hosting interactive presentations. Inspiring our users through quality support in a scalable way has been a contributing factor in the success of Mentimeter since its beginnings.
   

  

**Role Responsibilities**
 The primary responsibility of the Customer Insights Representative is to respond to customer inquiries through chat and email. Daily responsibilities include:
   

  

* Responding to support requests and inquiries from users all over the world via chat and email to help our users look like stars on stage (c. 75% of your time, occasional video call troubleshooting)
* Gather and share insights and feedback from our Enterprise users with product, sales and marketing
* Assist our team with administrative tasks such as managing payments, qualifying refunds, handling resellers and invoicing
* Working on other initiatives with the support team. For example, translating help articles and other support resources to better support our users across the globe
* Close collaboration with our Sales team to identify potential inbound Sales Leads and business opportunities


**We Believe You Have**
* Business-level English, with outstanding verbal and written skills
* Previous work experience in customer-facing roles for at least 2 years, full-time
* A sound level of technical understanding of websites and browsers to troubleshoot with customers
* Passion for customer service and helping others
* Bonus points for/if:
+ Previous copywriting experience
+ Prior experience working with enterprise customers (B2B) or working in sales
+ Business level German speaking and writing
+ Any other special interest that might be relevant (Let us know your skills!)
+ Previously worked with a Customer Support CRM such as Intercom, Zendesk, etc.


**What Resources Do We Have To Support You**
* A support team currently consisting of eleven colleagues
* First-in-class support tools and scalable solutions such as resolution bots, saved replies and a comprehensive help center
* Robust onboarding and hands-on training
* Beautiful office with everything you need to perform your work


**Information For Applicants**
* To support our global user base your working hours will be on a weekly rotation ranging from 08:00 - 17:00 to 10:00 - 19:00 (same hours for a full week)
* We strongly believe in the power of together! Being at the office is very important for collaboration and mutual learning, but we also like flexibility. We have a hybrid model where you can work from home for up to 2 days a week


**Recruitment Process**
* Alva Labs tests - conduct a personality and logical ability test as part of the screening process
* TA interview - Meet TA rep for introduction interview
* Business Case - Prepare a business case showcasing your skills, knowledge and core competencies
* Competence interview - Meet the team in an onsite interview
* Culture interview - Reflect & learn more about our 5 core values at Mentimeter


**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Once a year we also relocate to exciting places all over the world like Merida & Buenos Aires for our Toronto colleagues, cities in Europe (for our Stockholm colleagues), and cities in APAC (for our Sydney colleagues), paid for by us of course. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page .
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Client Services Executive Global Services Nordics
description:
**Job Description**
**Role purpose :**
 Are you looking for a customer centric role in the world of financial services? Do you excel in taking ownership, thinking outside of the box and putting the customer at the heart of what you do? Then this role could be the opportunity for you.
   

  

 As an Underwriting Service Coordinator, you will get to work within an international and dynamic environment within our Commercial Lines division in EMEA. You will proactively support underwriting teams by delivering high quality customer service, taking ownership of operational functions and service aspects, coordinating with a variety of different functions and teams, allowing underwriters to focus on production and underwriting
   

  

 The Underwriting Service Coordinator is responsible for supporting the end-to-end lifecycle of producing and issuing an insurance policy for our customers, along with any associated problem solving. For some parts you will be working with underwriters to create accurate and practical instructions for supporting teams to process information, for others you will be performing the processing yourself. This could include new business customers just joining us, renewal customers staying with us for another year, or it could be changes customers would like to make during the term of their insurance. All are to be approached and performed with the customer at the heart; wanting to ensure your work is correct when the customer needs it and to the agreed Chubb service standards.
   

  

**Key Responsabilities**
* Manage a portfolio of Domestic and Multinational accounts performing account administration and Multinational program implementation tasks. In conjunction to supporting our underwriters by providing them with underwriting, regulatory, and compliance information and or advice on program structures as well as preparing instructions for the processing and issuance of new business, renewals and endorsements, invoices, and documentation. All within the required time frames, and to the required quality standard applying right first-time principle
* Be a focal point for internal colleagues, working closely with Segment leaders, Line Managers, Underwriters, and our Service centres to deliver agreed client service standards, troubleshoot and solve any issues affecting the customer.
* Be a focal point for Broker administration queries with regards to local market practice, our market and service offering as well as regulatory / tax queries. In addition to supporting the timely resolution of credit control queries
* Assist where required with ongoing Projects that are identified throughout a given year for improvement to Line or Operations, being an expert on the process, a tester or helping others understand where opportunities for improvement in the process may be.
* Pro-actively hunt for opportunities of improving the customers’ experience and perform ad hoc associated work requests for your role


**Qualifications**
**Qualifications :**
* Insurance Certification
* University Degree


**Languages**
* Local Language
* Fluent English
* A foreign language would be an advantage.


**Experience**
* Experience of servicing multinational insurance programmes or servicing master policies (understanding of premium allocation, how policy is issued and booked)
* Working experience of at least 2 lines of business in insurance
* Experience on client facing roles in the insurance industry, including client meeting, presentations
* Practice of underwriting process and reinsurance process
* Proficient in MS office tools

title: Paid Social Specialist
description:
*Publicis Groupe is one of the largest communications groups in the world. We are building the agency model of the future and take a holistic approach to our clients’ challenges. By fusing together our media, creative, data and technology expertise, we are able to provide clients with integrated solutions, transformative ideas and compelling consumer experiences. We call it the Power of One.* 




*We are proud winner of many awards and nominations, both in Sweden and internationally. But nothing makes us prouder than to work with clients and brands such as Disney, Elgiganten, Mondelez, Essity, Volvo, VISA, Lantmännen, Nomad Foods, Lactalis, Midsona, Renault and many more.* 




  





*At Publicis, we put our people first. We are proud to be certified by Great Place to Work (2022, 2023, 2024), and have been recognized with a Magnet Award for our engaging culture (2023). Our goal is to become the leading workplace in our industry. We are based in a fantastic office in Odenplan, but also offer a flexible work policy.* 




  





***Please note that due to the holiday season, you may experience longer response times and delays between Midsummer and mid-August.***




  





**Job Description** 




  





 We are currently seeking talent for the Paid Social team. As a specialist, you will work alongside project managers and digital planners to execute results-driven campaigns on various social media channels such as Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat, TikTok, Pinterest, and others. Your ongoing tasks will include social media purchases; ranging from recommendations, campaign setups, campaign optimization, campaign analysis, and reporting.
 



  





 As a Paid Social Specialist, you will be responsible for the following areas:
 



  




* Creating and implementing tactical campaign recommendations within paid social.
* Planning, purchasing, optimizing, and regularly reporting social media campaigns.
* Handling campaigns practically via self-service tools including purchasing, optimization, and campaign management.
* Constantly analyzing and evaluating campaign results based on set goals.
* Various administrative tasks related to campaigns and customer work.



  





**Qualifications** 




  




* Academic or relevant post-secondary education.
* You are communicative, fluent in both Swedish and English, have a strong sense of service, and thoroughly enjoy yourrole as a consultant.
* You are curious and proactive with high accuracy and analytical ability.
* You are technically inclined and have an easy time learning to work in different systems.
* You enjoy working independently, in a structured manner, and adhere to set timelines.
* You are solution-oriented and are not afraid to work with new methods to achieve set goals.



  





**Additional Information** 




  





 In addition to a welcoming culture and inclusive environment with passionate colleagues we offer you:
 


* **Career Opportunities**



 Local and Global opportunities through the Power Of One.
 


* **Personal and Professional Learning**



 Global AI learning platform where you can participate in +30 000 classes and connect with colleagues from all over the world.
 


* **Flexible Ways of Working**



 We want to be an employer where work life balance is cherished. We love to spend time with our colleagues at the office but also believe in the output of your work not where the work is being done.
 


* **Work Your World**



 For six weeks a year, the world is yours. Every employee can work anywhere on the planet where there's a Publicis office. A new city, a favorite locale, or even a different country - Go. Grow. Explore.
 


* **Mental Health**



 The happiness and health of our people is paramount to us. We work continuously on maintaining a healthy and safe working environment through initiatives that facilitate the well-being of our employees.
 


* **Benefits**



 Generous benefit package.
 



  





***Please note that due to the holiday season, you may experience longer response times and delays between Midsummer and mid-August.***

title: 2024 Corporate & Investment Bank - Investment Banking Analyst Program - Off-Cycle Internship (September-December) - Stockholm
description:
**Job Description**
 Join our team of top professionals for an internship that shapes the global economy. We focus on long-term relationships and strategies that foster growth and innovation for our clients. We provide sound advice, access to funds, and connections, while managing risks in today's complex environment. Your diverse perspective will help us innovate the next wave of products and solutions. We offer comprehensive training, mentoring from senior leaders, and engaging projects to ensure your success.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 As a
 **2024 Corporate & Investment Bank - Investment Banking Analyst Program - Off-Cycle Internship (September-December) - Stockholm** 
 within JPMorgan Chase, you will spend your internship alongside top professionals in the business, developing strategies that help our government, institutional, and corporate clients grow and innovate. You will have the opportunity to analyse market data, manage client transactions, and come up with innovative solutions to complex business challenges. We will provide you with the necessary support and training to help you succeed in this dynamic and collaborative work environment.:
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Analyse market data, building detailed financial models and preparing client presentations for mergers and acquisitions, leveraged buyouts and capital markets advisory.
* Manage client transactions from pitch to close under the guidance of our senior leaders.
* Come up with innovative and creative ways to solve complex, real-world business challenges.
* Learn how we help clients and communities grow, no matter their needs.
* Sharpen your technical skills.
* Build your professional network with mentors, senior executives and others.


**Required Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills.**
* Excellent analytical, quantitative and interpretative skills
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic, collaborative work environment
* Being adaptable, flexible and resilient
* Knowing your way around Excel, PowerPoint and Word
* Fluency in English and either Danish, Norwegian or Swedish
* Expected graduation date between January 2024 and December 2025. If you plan to pursue further education beyond your undergraduate studies, please ensure this is accurately reflected in the graduation date entered on your application
* You must be available during the months stated in the Job Title


**Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities And Skills**
* Being on-track for a United Kingdom 2:1 Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in your undergraduate studies.


 But beyond that, what we’re most interested in are the things that make you, you: the personal qualities, outside interests and achievements beyond academia that demonstrate the kind of person you are and the difference you could bring to the team.
   

  

**Application deadline: 30th June 2024**
 Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. We strongly encourage you to submit your application as early as possible as programs will close once positions are filled.
   

  

**Join Us**
 At JPMorgan Chase, we’re creating positive change for the diverse communities we serve. We do this by championing your innovative ideas through a supportive culture that helps you every step of the way as you build your career. If you’re passionate, curious and ready to make an impact, we’re looking for you.
   

  

**What’s Next**
 Help us learn about you by submitting a complete and thoughtful application, which includes your resume. Your application and resume is a way for us to initially get to know you, so it’s important to complete all relevant application questions so we have as much information about you as possible.
   

  

 After you confirm your application, we will review it to determine whether you meet certain required qualifications.
   

  

 If you are advanced to the next step of the process, you’ll receive an email invitation to complete a video interview, powered by HireVue. This is your opportunity to further bring your resume to life and showcase your experience for our recruiting team and hiring managers.
   

  

 Completion of the HireVue video interview is required, and your application will not be considered for further review until you have completed it. We strongly encourage that you apply and complete this as soon as possible, since programs will close as positions are filled.
   

  

**About Us**
 J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world’s most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.
   

  

 We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.

title: Teamledare/Projektledare inom Automation med inriktning Life Science
description:
Svenska Life Science-branschen har genom åren bekräftat en välkänd position som innovatör och strategisk partner i jakten på nya behandlingar för patienter världen över. Vi ser idag branschens växande behov av nya lösningar och tillgång till rätt spetskompetens, vilket vi på Rejlers ser som en perfect match. Med de mest kompetenta, engagerade och kundfokuserade LS-konsulterna i branschen vill vi växa och utvecklas tillsammans med våra kunder och forma framtidens Life Science i Sverige.
   

  

**About The Job**
 Är du redo för en spännande resa inom Life Science? Vi på Rejlers söker nu en nyfiken och kreativ person som har ett genuint intresse för att skapa en säkrare framtid. Hos oss får du inte bara möjligheten att
 **utvecklas personligen** 
 och
 **professionellt** 
 , utan också att vara med och
 **forma framtidens Life Science** 
 i Sverige. Vi söker nu en Teamledare/Projektledare inom Automation som ska arbeta mot Life Science.
   

  

**Leda arbetet i projektform och skriva, granska, godkänna och i vissa fall utföra:**
* DCS – URS/FDS och tekniska specifikationer
* DCS hårdvaru- och mjukvarutestspecifikationer
* Avvikelser och testdokumentation
* Testplaner och testprotokoll
* Spårbarhetsmatriser
* Arbeta med kundens automations-/OT/IT-hård- och mjukvaruteam för att granska produktkrav och specifikationer


 Så med det sagt kan man lugnt säga att du kommer bli en enormt viktigt del av teamet och Rejlers. 😊
   

  

**WHO ARE YOU?**
 Vi tror att du har en hög kompetens inom
 **projektledning/
 **teamledare/automation****
 och har ett
 **naturligt engagemang** 
 för att säkerställa kvaliteten i varje steg av processen. För att lyckas i rollen krävs det också en förståelse för GxP praxis för automatiserade system och kännedom om ISO13485 och ISO9001. Kvalifikationer bör inkludera åtminstone
 **fem års arbete med automation** 
 , även om ytterligare erfarenhet också värderas högt.
   

  

 👉 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet inom mjukvaru- och hårdvaruutveckling, samt kompetens inom DCS och system som Emerson Delta V , Siemens PCS7 och ABB800xA.
   

  

 ➕ Tidigare erfarenhet av industriprojekt inom Life Science och utveckling av medicintekniska instrument och system är också ett plus. Du förväntas också kunna kommunicera obehindrat på både svenska och engelska.
   

  

**What You Get**
 Som konsult hos oss på Life Science blir en du en del av ett
 **kompetent** 
 och
 **hjälpsamt** 
 gäng. Jan Idman blir din närmaste ledare och Jan står för ett
 **inkluderande** 
 ledarskap,
 **frihet under ansvar** 
 , det som behöver utvecklas det tar man tag i och löser tillsammans!
   

  

 Här på Rejlers får du möjlighet att
 **utvecklas** 
 i din roll och inom Life Science teamet som du kommer tillhöra finns det möjlighet att på riktigt vara med och
 **påverka** 
 utvecklingen framåt.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder en
 **rolig** 
 och
 **stimulerande** 
 arbetsplats i ett bolag med
 **stor framtidstro** 
 och högt i tak. Vår kultur präglas av en familjär och personlig stämning där vi är måna om att våra medarbetare ska trivas och må bra. Vill du få en sneakpeak på vårt huvudkontor i Stockholm kan du klicka in här 👈
   

  

**Varmt välkommen till Rejlers " Home of the learning minds"! 🧠**
*Som ett kvalitativt led i våra rekryteringsprocesser kommer en bakgrundskontroll genomföras på slutkandidaten. Vissa roller kräver även annan kontroll, såsom t.ex. säkerhetsprövning, innan uppdrag hos vissa kunder - om det är aktuellt för tjänsten du sökt så kommer du att få mer information kring det i ett senare skede. Ytterligare information finns även på vår hemsida.*
 Behandling av personuppgifter | Rejlers
   

  

 Läs mer om din rekryteringsresa och våra olika steg i processen --> här!
   

  

*Vi granskar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan komma att bli tillsatt innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**HOME**
 Våra medarbetare är grunden till vår framgång och utveckling. Hos oss ska varje medarbetare känna sig betydelsefull, uppmärksammad och delaktig.
   

  

**LEARNING**
 Våra medarbetares kunskap och erfarenhet helt avgörande för vår framgång och förmåga att utveckla morgondagens hållbara samhälle. Lärandet är med oss hela tiden i allt vi gör – hos oss är man under ständig utveckling!
   

  

**MINDS**
 Med en nyfiken inställning som uppmuntrar och inspirerar till nytänkande, vågar vi utmana både oss själva och vår omgivning. Vi har ett starkt fokus på ett uppmuntrande, tillitsfullt och kommunikativt ledarskap. Lika viktigt är medarbetarskapet där vi alla har ett eget ansvar för lärande och ständig utveckling.
   

  

 Läs mer om vår kultur här: Our Culture | Rejlers

title: Dokumentcontroller
description:
Vill du jobba för att Stockholm ska bli världens mest hållbara stad? Vi är Sveriges ledande vatten- och avfallsbolag som varje dag tar ansvar för stockholmarnas och miljöns bästa i allt vi gör, både nu och för kommande generationer. Tillsammans arbetar vi för att Stockholm ska bli världens mest hållbara stad.
 



  





 Är du den som kan hjälpa oss att lyfta bolagets informationshantering? Vi söker dig som kan svara på frågor från medarbetarna om allmänna handlingar, informationshantering, bevarande, gallring och diarieföring.
 



  





 Informationshantering är en viktig och prioriterad del av vår verksamhet och vi behöver stärka upp vårt team för att möta verksamheternas behov. Som dokumentcontroller ingår du i Säkerhets- och informationsenheten och du rapporterar till teamledare. Tillsammans med ditt team hjälper du bolaget med informationshanteringsfrågor genom att skapa förutsättningar för ett bra arbete och du arbetar aktivt med att följa upp att lagkrav efterlevs gällande säker och långsiktig hantering av information. Teamet består av sex medarbetare i rollerna arkivarie, IT-arkivarie, dokumentcontrollers och en teamledare.
 



  





 Din huvudsakliga arbetsplats är på vårt kontor i Ulvsunda, men arbete förekommer även på våra andra anläggningar och kontor. Du har möjlighet att arbeta på distans upp till 50% efter överenskommelse med närmsta chef.
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifter** 




 Som dokumentcontroller har du en viktig roll i att ta hand om företagets material och göra det sökbart och säkrat. Du verkar som stöd till alla bolagets verksamheter och anläggningar vid deras frågor om informationshantering. Du har därmed en nyckelfunktion när det kommer till att stötta verksamheten med alltifrån rådgivning till utbildning och handledning inom informationshantering och dataskydd.
 



  





**Som en del i det dagliga arbetet kommer du hantera uppgifter såsom att:** 



* Diarieföra analog post och arkivlägga handlingar
* Bevaka vår funktionsbrevlåda för inkommande e-post för att snabbt kunna ta hand om eller vidarebefordra inkommande e-post
* Skapa ärenden i Platina, samt söka fram handlingar analogt i arkivet eller digitalt
* Samordna utlämnande av allmän handling



  





 Därutöver kommer du utföra kvalitetsinsatser inom registrering och ordnande av allmänna handlingar i enlighet med gällande lagar och regelverk. I ditt ansvar ingår även att stötta i framtagandet av informationshanteringsplaner och andra dokument som berör diarieföring, samt delta i beredande och implementerande av styrande och redovisande dokument på informationshanteringsområdet (till exempel informationsredovisning). Vid behov deltar du även i aktuella projekt.
 



  





**Kvalifikationer** 




 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi gärna att du har:
 


* Högskoleutbildning inom arkiv- och informationsvetenskap eller motsvarande relevant erfarenhet från tidigare anställning
* God kunskap om de legala krav som påverkar informationshanteringen i stort, i både fysiska och digitala processer
* Tidigare erfarenhet av att arbeta med arkiv- och registratur i offentlig verksamhet
* Goda kunskaper i Svenska språket givet arbetets karaktär



  





 Vi ser det som meriterande om du dessutom har erfarenhet av informationshanteringsarbete med säkerhetsskyddsklassade handlingar och god kunskap om innebörden av Dataskyddsförordningen (GDPR) och dess tillämpningsområden.
 



  





 I den här rekryteringen lägger vi även stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. Vi ser värdet av din förmåga att lösningsorienterat hitta lösningar på uppkomna problem där möjligheterna är i fokus. Du är även en lagspelare som har lätt att samarbeta med andra och anpassa dig för att hitta win-win-scenarion i strävan mot gemensamma mål. Du visar prov på god självledarförmåga och har ett inre driv, samt är trygg i att stå upp för dina åsikter i främmande sammanhang.
 



  





**Övrigt** 




 Bra för dig att känna till är att vi kommer att annonsera under sommaren och urval sker från mitten av augusti.
 



  





 För oss är medarbetarnas hälsa i fokus. Vi underlättar för dig att göra hälsosamma val och att kunna kombinera arbete, fritid och familj. Vi erbjuder därför många av våra medarbetare förmånligt flextidsavtal och möjlighet att jobba hemifrån. Läs mer om oss på vår hemsida svoa.se/jobb.
 



  





 För att matchningen oss emellan ska bli så bra som möjligt har vi valt att jobba med rekryteringstester i vår urvalsprocess. Då vi är en arbetsgivare som värnar om och strävar efter en trygg arbetsmiljö för våra medarbetare och vår samhällsviktiga funktion, kommer du som slutkandidat att genomföra ett drogtest hos vår hälsopartner.
 



  





 Då du i din tjänst kommer att arbeta med säkerhetsklassad information, innebär det att även säkerhetsprövning och registerkontroll kommer att genomföras i samband med anställning.
 



  





**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!** 




 Ansök senast: 2024-08-11
 



 Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning
 



 Omfattning: Heltid
 



  





**Kontakt** 




 Sara Ljungblad Söderlund
 



*Teamledare* 




 Telefon:
 
 0852213275
 




 E-post:
 
 sara.ljungblad.soderlund@svoa.se

title: Domain Architect - Analytics
description:
Welcome to Husqvarna Group. Our charm lies in being that small company - that has successfully grown big (but still, with that start-up feeling). Because, we're not just a workplace; we're a creative culture that embraces trying new things - and really enjoys the excitement of making them happen.
 



  





  

 And now, we want you to be a part of it
 



  





**.
   

 Who We Ar** 




  





 e:
   

 Welcome to a dynamic and forward-thinking team led by Peter, dedicated to revolutionizing how businesses leverage data and analytics. The team’s focus spans two key areas: Business Analytics and Master Data. We're on a mission to challenge the traditional, siloed approach to business and IT, fostering a united front were business and IT work together seamless
 



  





 ly.
   

 Our goal is to create agile teams and competencies that drive real business value, faster and more efficiently. We're not just about theory and planning – we believe in doing, experimenting, and constantly improving – in a stepwise approach. Change is our mantra, and we embrace it wholehearte
 



  





 dly.
   

 If you are driven by innovation and excel in environments where you can make a tangible impact, this is your a
 



  





**rena.
   

 Why You Should Jo** 




  





 in Us:
   

 At our core, we believe in empowerment and growth. Here, your ideas matter and you'll have the chance to shape your own role and the future of our projects. We offer an open, transparent environment where questions are encouraged and learning never stops, providing you with the perfect opportunity to grow in an exciting, innovative
 



  





 field.
   

 You'll be part of a team driving real change, transforming how businesses operate and make decisions through the power of Data and AI. Working closely with experienced professionals like your future colleague Göran, our current Domain Architect within Analytics, you’ll eventually take the lead in the area, as he transitions into retirement in the future. Until then, you will be each other’s sparring partners as Domain Arc
 



  





**hitects.

title: Corporate Security Manager
description:
Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all of these services. With our thought leadership and culture of innovation, we apply industry expertise, diverse skills and next-generation technology to each business challenge. We serve clients in more than 120 countries with over 745 000 employees.
   

  

 We believe in inclusion and diversity and supporting the whole person. Our core values comprise of Stewardship, Best People, Client Value Creation, One Global Network, Respect for the Individual and Integrity. Year after year, Accenture is recognized worldwide not just for business performance but for inclusion and diversity too.
   

  

**Overview of the Team:**
 People are at the heart of Global Assistance and Protection (GAP), Accenture’s Corporate Security Team. We are an organization of highly skilled experts and diverse professionals who take immense pride in serving Accenture and helping grow the business. The Regional Protective Services team is a core part of GAP with members based out of various regions of the world.
   

  

**Job Summary:**
 Reporting to the Associate Director, Regional Protective Services EMEA, the Regional Protective Services Manager is a full-time role, responsible for incident and crisis management; physical security advice; investigations; workplace violence prevention and planning; behavioural threat assessment and management; executive protection, event and travel security support; geo-political threat monitoring; security vendor management support and security training within the area of responsibility.
   

  

 The successful candidate will be providing guidance and support in a complicated corporate environment that values collaboration, independent thinking, proactive problem-solving, integrity, collegiality, efficiency, and continuous organizational transformation. They are expected to develop a close collaborative relationship with Accenture’s Business, IT, Cyber Security, Legal, Travel, Workplace, and HR leaders as well as with domestic and foreign law enforcement and diplomatic and intelligence services.
   

  

 They will support the wider European Regional Protective Services Team; is required to be flexible and be available on call (24\*7); able to travel 50% of the time & work outside normal business hours and at short notice.
   

  

**Responsibilities may include some or all the below:**
**Security Management:**
- Foster security culture and awareness.

- Apply broad security risk management knowledge, understanding of policies, procedures, and frameworks to enable business operations activities.

- Contribute / implement security strategy, plans, procedures, and controls.

- Identify, anticipate, assess, and help resolve complex business challenges where collaboration and cooperation between individuals is often needed to affect the solution.

- Conduct security surveys, internal and externals audits & reviews.

- Cultivate, build engagement / relationships with internal and external stake holders including vendors, industry organizations, law enforcement and other related government agencies.

- Establish near term goals and provide input to longer term goals within the area of responsibility; contribute to long-term planning.

- Maintain awareness of relevant EU regulations and decisions.

**Crisis Management, Risk Intelligence, Event Monitoring, and Employee Notification:**
- As SME (crisis and incident management) serve as a key contact for internal and external stake holders.

- Deal with difficult and critical situations appropriately and confidentially.

- Manage incident notification and security assessments by vendors to ensure the timely receipt of information and analysis on events which could impact Accenture’s facilities, people, or operations.

- Lead all aspects of the dissemination of such information to Accenture leadership and coordinate any messaging to employees.

- Be on point for critical issues from the Global Accenture Security Operations Center.

**Personnel Security:**
- Active member of Behavioural Threat Assessment Teams (BTAT).

- Support employees/contractors/clients affected by internal / external security incidents.

- Conduct threat assessments to include domestic and international operations and disseminate findings as needed.

- Support security awareness training, hotel-residential, office and travel security.

- Support executive protection and event security management.

**Basic Qualifications:**
- Significant relevant security experience required, or equivalent experience in private, government, or security forces.

- Motivated to work in a meritocratic, collaborative culture emphasizing work ethic, humility, collaboration, and a "roll-up your sleeves mentality."

- Forward-thinking and highly responsive, capable of pivoting quickly between projects and priorities to meet time-sensitive deadlines.

- Uncompromised ethics and integrity are essential.

- Possession of industry-recognized local and international professional security certifications is advantageous.

- Proficiency in English, both written and verbal.

**Other desired competencies include:**
- Proficient in Microsoft suite – Word, Excel, PowerPoint.

- Strong analytical skills; adept at understanding complex issues and deploying creative problem-solving.

- Natural leader with the ability to establish trust-based relationships and gain insights through collaboration.

- Effective time management and multitasking abilities.

- Experience in corporate security management, including understanding of the investigative process.

- Extensive knowledge of physical security and systems, along with familiarity with safety/security in a corporate environment.

- Basic understanding of legal and corporate terminology.

- Exposure and demonstrated ability to work in multicultural environments.

title: Account Executive, Public Sector
description:
**Why You Should Apply**
* You will deliver objective, actionable insights to CIOs and their teams within Public Sector clients in Sweden.
* You will join a high-performing, global company that is seeing double-digit growth for 40+ consecutive quarters.
* You will work in a highly collaborative sales environment with excellent career growth opportunities – 95% of our leadership positions were hired internally.


**Position Summary**
 For our office in Solna, we’re looking for an Account Executive to partner with new and existing clients within Public Sector.
   

  

 As an experienced sales professional, you will address your clients’ most critical priorities. You will identify opportunities for account retention and growth through contract expansion, introducing new services and products. This is a field-based role, selling directly to Large Enterprise clients; organisations with $750M+ in annual revenue, which includes 77% of the Global F500.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Quota of approximately $1M in contract value across 5-10 large enterprise accounts.
* Build trust-based, value-added relationships with C-level executives and their teams, primarily the CIO and CIO office.
* Drive account retention and growth by impacting their most critical priorities and demonstrate Gartner’s value.
* Drive new business with new logos, through networking, events and your own prospecting.
* Utilise industry knowledge of your specific market segment, stay up to date with trends to ensure an effective go to market approach.
* Collaborate across teams, regions and departments, sharing best practice, to ensure a best-in-class approach to strategic initiatives and growth plans
* Support the business in improving diversity, developing fellow associates, and growing the team within an inclusive environment


**Requirements**
* 5+ years of relevant sales experience, of which at least 2 years in a tech/IT environment. Direct sales experience within a software vendor, system integrator, IT consultancy & services, or a similar environment is highly relevant for this role.
* Experience selling to senior leaders, preferably the CIO.
* A track record of consistent (over)achievement on your goals and targets.
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree is desirable.
* Fluency in Swedish and English.
* Experience using Challenger Sales or a similar sales method is a plus.


**What Gartner Gives You**
* Uncapped earnings and challenging and achievable quotas – 85% of our salesforce hit quota, unlocking accelerators every year
* An all-expenses paid "Winners Circle" trip for top performers; every year, 40-50% of sales associates qualify for this
* Best-in-class training, including an intensive 2-week sales expedition for new hires and continuous support after that
* Growth opportunities: our business is seeing double-digit growth, providing plenty of internal career development opportunities.
* Excellent corporate benefits.
* Collaborative, team-oriented culture that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion, to empower each associate to be their authentic and best self.
* Virtual first policy, giving the chance to combine working from office and home
* The opportunity to work with Global 500 and sell at C-level and work with some of the brightest minds in the industry and help them to build the successful organisations of tomorrow


**Who are we?**
 At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
   

  

 Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.
   

  

 Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
   

  

**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**
 Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
   

  

 We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
   

  

 Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.
   

  

 We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.
   

  

 In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
   

  

 Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.
   

  

 The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to affirmatively seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
   

  

 Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
   

  

 Job Requisition ID:88480
   

  

 By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
   

  

 Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy
   

  

**For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.**

title: Dynamics 365 CE Consultant
description:
At Avanade, we see how the power of Dynamics 365 shapes the future of businesses every day. By combining our unmatched Microsoft knowledge with our creative approach to innovation and strong industry knowledge, we create a lot of opportunities for Microsoft, our clients, and for you. Avanade has countless paths for you to pursue. One of them is sure to lead to your unique version of success.
   

  

**Come join us**
 As a Dynamics 365 CRM Consultant, you will be client-facing and responsible for the discovery, scoping, and collection of requirements to build and deploy solutions that are tailored to your customer. You will be a part of the Nordics CE (Customer Engagement) practice that consists of around 60 members in different roles as Solution Architects, Business Analysts, Developers, and Functional Consultants. We primarily work with Dynamics 365 and Power Platform and often collaborate with other practices, especially with Data & AI and Software Engineering. We have flexible work arrangements so you can work either from home or at Avanade's or our clients offices.
   

  

**Skills And Experiences**
* Experience working as a Technical CRM Consultant
* Hands-on experience with Dynamics 365 and Power Platform (e.g., Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI and Power Virtual Agents)
* Technical experience and/or ability to configure and customize Dynamics 365 modules (e.g., CE, Sales and/or Customer Service. Having Field Service experience is a plus)
* Experience working with no-code/low-code development
* Great interpersonal skills and experience in customer-facing roles
* Fluent in any Scandinavian language and English


**This Will Help You Stand Out**
* Programming skills and understanding of JavaScript, C# and the .NET-framework
* Relevant Dynamics 365 CE/CRM and/or Power Platform certifications
* Experience leading project teams on a day-to-day basis with expertise, guidance and mentorship
* Bachelor's or master's degree in the field of IT such as Computer Science, Information Systems, E-Business or similar


**About You**
 Characteristics that can spell success for this role
   

  

* Consultative, collaborative, relationship builder
* Resilient, adaptable, flexible
* Intellectually curious and passionate about tech
* Client-centric attitude
* Passion for learning and development


**What You'll Do**
* Consult and advise our clients and internal stakeholders on uses of technology to solve business problems
* Participate in client workshops to analyze and design solutions
* Collaborate with project teams in customizing, developing and extending Dynamics 365 CE and utilize the Power Platform to meet client needs
* Actively participating across all project phases (e.g., plan, analyze, design, build and test)
* Demonstrating a commitment to your professional development by actively obtaining relevant Power Platform (e.g., PL-200) and Dynamics CRM certifications
* Depending on your seniority, you may lead project teams with expertise and guidance


**Learn more**
 Interested to hear more? Apply today, we can't wait to hear from you!
   

  

**Enjoy your career**
 Some of the best things about working at Avanade
   

  

* Pathway to work on industry leading programs of work
* Opportunity to work with global customers
* A people-first culture that supports innovation to push teams in new directions
* Quickly turn your ideas to human impact by cultivating a team that will help clients unlock what’s next
* Real-time access to technical and skilled resources globally


**A great place to work**
 As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you’ll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and our communities. You’ll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, and to lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. It’s all here, so take a closer look!

title: Senior Consultant Digital Trust & Security
description:
**Are you passionate about building secure digital futures for clients and do you thrive at the intersection of strategy and execution? If so, this is your opportunity to make an impact as one of our Senior Consultants in Digital Trust & Security at Capgemini Invent.** 




  





 At Capgemini Invent, we help businesses navigate the ever-evolving landscape of digital transformation. As a leading management consultancy, we empower our clients to embrace new technologies while safeguarding their critical data and assets.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 
 As a Senior Consultant in our Digital Trust & Security practice, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of how we help clients build resilience and achieve their strategic goals. Key responsibilities include:
 


* Design, develop, and implement cutting-edge cyber and data protection strategies, including best-in-class awareness programs.
* Conduct maturity level assessments, benchmarking clients' security posture against national and international standards.
* Develop robust governance, risk, and compliance frameworks, incorporating both traditional and innovative approaches.
* Guide clients through business resilience transformations, ensuring they are prepared for any crisis or disruption.
* Champion the integration of Digital Trust & Security into cloud and digital workplace initiatives.
* Collaborate closely with our Nordic Digital Trust & Security teams.



  





 We are driven by a shared purpose: Unleashing human energy through technology, data, creative and innovation for an inclusive and sustainable future.
 **The person we want to invite to join our mission will likely have:** 



* Proven experience leading digital transformation projects focused on information security, data protection, or cybersecurity, and the application of cybertechnology.
* Previous management consulting experience.
* Degree in economics, technology (including cyber-related technology), or IT.
* Passion for combining strategic thinking with hands-on implementation.
* High integrity, collaborative spirit, and a strong fit with our dynamic culture.
* Excellent presentation and facilitation skills.
* Fluency in English, with Swedish or another Scandinavian language being a plus.
* Familiarity with current security standards (ISO 2700x, NIST) is advantageous.
* Relevant certifications (ISO 2700x, CISM, CISA, CISSP) and experience with legal and regulatory requirements (EU-GDPR, NIS2) are a strong plus.



  





**What We Offer:** 



* The opportunity to shape the future of a leading management consultancy practice.
* Collaborate with a team of passionate and talented professionals.
* Make a real difference for our clients, helping them thrive in today’s digital world.
* Build a rewarding career with a company that invests in your growth and development.



  





**Sounds like the next step in your career?** 
 If you are ready to innovate and drive change in the realm of Digital Trust & Security, apply now, and build a secure digital future with Capgemini Invent.
 **Please submit your application and CV in English.** 
 We screen CVs on a continuous basis and encourage you to apply as soon as possible!
 



  





 Capgemini (traded as CAP on the Euronext Paris) is a leading strategic partner to companies around the world, we have leveraged technology to enable business transformation since our inception in Paris, more than 50 years ago. As the advisory and digital strategy, transformation, innovation, and creative brand of the Capgemini Group, Capgemini Invent enables CxOs to envision and shape the future of their businesses. Located in nearly 40 studios and more than 60 offices around the world, it comprises a 12,000+ strong team of
 **strategists, data scientists, product and experience designers, brand experts and technologists** 
 who develop new digital services, products, experiences and business models for sustainable growth.
 



  





 Get to know us better! Please visit www.capgemini.com/invent, look us up on Instagram
 **@capgeminiinvent\_swedfi** 
 or listen in to an episode of our podcast
 **Future Sight with Capgemini Invent** 
 , available on Spotify.

title: Compliance Officer
description:
**Who we’re looking for!**
 Are you excited about working with compliance, certifications, and information security in an international setup? Then we might have a role for you!
   

  

 We are looking for a Compliance Officer to join our Legal & Compliance team. In this role, you will take responsibility for Banqsoft compliance with our certifications and internal & external requirements regarding Banqsoft operations and deliveries.
   

  

 As a Compliance Officer you will be responsible for driving Banqsoft’s compliance strategies throughout the organization, including following up ISAE 3402, ISO 27001, ISO 14001 certifications as well as the internal audit program.
   

  

 Our Legal & Compliance team consist of Head of Legal & Compliance, Compliance Officer, Information Security Manager and Quality Manager. We have a partnership with our owner, KMD, including KMD Group information security and compliance resources.
   

  

 You’re strongly aligned with our
 **Employee DNA** 
 which celebrates curiosity, collaboration, competence, and customer focus.
   

  

**What does the role look like?**
* Develop and maintain a compliance and certification strategy, in collaboration with management.
* Lead, plan, prepare and follow-up all certifications, and external and internal audits.
* Continuously review new requirements related to compliance and certifications.
* Coordinating management review in Banqsoft.
* Managing compliance risks, including risk assessments and follow ups of findings.
* Maintain and develop documentation regarding compliance and certifications in Banqsoft Integrated Management System (ISMS & EMS)


**Succeeding the Banqsoft way – Employee DNA**
**Curiosity:** 
 We embrace the 'Why?’. It’s the spark that ignites learning, innovation, and progress.
   

  

**Collaboration:** 
 Team players with diverse perspectives have more fun building together
   

  

**Competence:** 
 We're hungry for more! Ever ready for new skills and always seeking to learn.
   

  

**Customer Focus:** 
 We're dedicated to enabling our customers' success. We deliver the benefits of technology to make a difference in society, business, and everyday life.
   

  

**Are we a great match?**
 To master the role of Compliance Officer we believe that you have:
   

  

* 5+ years of experience within information security certification compliance.
* ISO 27001 Lead Implementor certification.
* Previously worked with Information Security Management Frameworks, such as ISO 27001.
* A bachelor’s degree or similar level of qualifications.
* Good understanding and knowledge of regulatory requirements, preferably within Banking & Finance.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and one Scandinavian language.
* Strong alignment with our Employee DNA.


**It’s great if you have (but not a must!):**
* Previously worked with Quality Management Frameworks
* Previous experience working with SharePoint


 If you believe this role aligns with your career aspirations, we would very much like to hear from you!

title: FP&A Controller to Visit Group Stockholm
description:
*Are you ready to rock the finance world with your analytical expertise and business insight? At Visit Group, we're not just another finance team—we’re a collective of innovative thinkers and creative minds. From the drum set in our reception to the guitars and art decorating our walls, our office shows a vibrant, artistic energy that mirrors our dynamic company culture. Recently partially acquired by a leading PE firm, we're on a thrilling growth journey, and we want you to be part of it!*
**Your role**
 As our new FP&A Controller, you’ll be a pivotal player in our Group Finance team. This role is all about strategic financial planning, analysis, and business partnering to drive performance and provide insightful guidance. You'll work closely with the Group CFO towards our Gothenburg headquarters.
   

  

**Main Tasks & Responsibilities**
* Drive performance visibility for the company and the Group, internally and externally, including Board reporting.
* Manage operational responsibilities across various geographies, gaining international exposure.
* Implement and refine models for operations, budgeting, and forecasting.
* Lead the forecasting and budgeting processes at a consolidation level.
* Actively participate in the month-end close process, ensuring timely and accurate reporting.
* Translate KPIs into actionable insights for the management team, refining business strategy and decision-making.
* Develop a single source of truth for data, create dashboards, and leverage data in forecasts and performance analysis.


**Your profile**
 To thrive in this role at Visit Group, you'll need to be a collaborative team player with a passion for driving business success. Your natural curiosity and initiative will help you develop the business further. A strategic mindset, strong motivation, and excellent problem-solving skills are essential. You should be adept at analysing complex data and communicating insights effectively across all levels of staff.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field.
* At least 3-5 years of experience in FP&A roles
* FP&A Operational responsibilities across multiple geographies (ideally Europe) with international exposure
* Experience in implementing operating models, budgeting and forecasting models
* Prior experience of working in an investor-backed business (PE, VC or similar) and be a key point of contact for Board reporting and shareholders relations
* Experience in a high-growth software or SaaS company.
* MS Excel skills, and familiarity with ERP systems (Visma experience preferred)
* Fluent in both English and Swedish, with excellent verbal and written communication skills.


**About Visit Group**
 At Visit Group, we foster an entrepreneurial environment where innovation and initiative are celebrated. We believe in learning from mistakes and encourage employees to try new things. You'll have the opportunity to grow within your role and the organization, potentially forming your own team.
   

  

 We offer flexible working hours and a blend of home and office work, though we love seeing our team in the office most of the time. Our office is not just a place to work; it’s a place to connect. We work out together twice a week and share breakfast once a week, reinforcing our strong team spirit.
   

  

 Read more about us www.visitgroup.com
   

  

 Ready to join a finance team that rocks? Apply now and let’s create something amazing together!
   

  

**Join us?**
 In this recruitment process Visit Group partner with SEVR Finance Recruitment. For more information, please feel free to contact the responsible recruitment consultant Elin Lindén on 0721-74 66 75 or elin.linden@sevr.se or Anna Klimenko on 0793-34 13 37 or anna.klimenko@sevr.se.
   

  

 Interviews and selection process will be ongoing, so please send us your application as soon as possible. We are looking forward hearing from you.

title: UCPM Expert for multi-year resilience project in Ukraine
description:
**Introduction**
 The Swedish Civil Contingencies Agency (MSB) recruits committed and skilled experts for our humanitarian, resilience and peace support operations worldwide on a daily basis. We have great experience on working together and strengthening other organisations, for example other civil protection agencies to prevent and prepare for crisis, conflicts or other disasters. MSB has actively supported Ukrainian and multilateral partners with expertise, capacity development and materials already before Russia’s full-scale invasion of the country. MSB is now planning for a multi-year capacity development partnership in line with Swedish priorities aiming to increase Ukraine’s resilience and capability to reduce and manage consequences of emergencies and war.
   

  

 MSB is looking for an UCPM Expert for one of the project components focusing on developing a long- term partnership with the State Emergency Service of Ukraine (SESU), acting as the main civil protection agency in Ukraine. One initially identified area for collaboration with SESU lie within support to developing both organizational aspects and operational capabilities within the framework of an integration into the UCPM. Ukraine became a participating state within the UCPM in April 2023 and is now working towards becoming a full member as a part of the EU accession process. Since the start of the war, SESU has communicated with the UCPM regarding requesting and receiving international support. Through the MSB led programme PPRD East 3 and other initiatives SESU has strengthened the organisational knowledge on UCPM through trainings.
   

  

 This is a homebased position with frequent travels to Kyiv, Ukraine. It’s a fixed-term position during the projects first six months inception phase with an estimated working period of 30-35 days (can be adjusted slightly upwards). For this position it is required that you are resident in Sweden and obtain a Swedish work permit.
   

  

 Preliminary start in aug/sept 2024.
   

  

**Introduction swedish**
 Myndigheten för samhällsskydd och beredskap (MSB) rekryterar dagligen engagerade och kompetenta experter till våra nationella, internationella, humanitära och resiliens- och fredsfrämjande insatser. Vi har stor erfarenhet av att arbeta tillsammans och stärka andra organisationer som t.ex. andra civilskyddsmyndigheter vid kriser, konflikter eller andra katastrofer. MSB har aktivt stöttat ukrainska och andra parter med expertis, kapacitetsutveckling och material redan före Rysslands fullskaliga invasion av landet. MSB planerar nu för ett flerårigt samarbete för kapacitetsutveckling i linje med svenska prioriteringar som syftar till att öka Ukrainas motståndskraft och förmåga att minska och hantera konsekvenserna av kriser och krig.
   

  

 MSB söker nu en UCPM-expert till en del av projektet med fokus på att utveckla ett långsiktigt partnerskap med Ukrainas räddningstjänst (SESU), som hanterar merparten av räddningstjänsten i Ukraina. Ett initialt identifierat område för samverkan med SESU ligger inom stöd för att utveckla såväl organisatoriska aspekter som operativa förmågor inom ramen för en integration i UCPM. Ukraina blev en deltagande stat inom UCPM i april 2023 och arbetar nu för att bli en fullvärdig medlem som en del av EU-anslutningsprocessen. Sedan krigets början har SESU kommunicerat med UCPM angående att begära och ta emot internationellt stöd. Genom det MSB-ledda programmet PPRD East 3 och andra initiativ har SESU stärkt den organisatoriska kunskapen om UCPM genom utbildning och övning.
   

  

 Tjänsten är hemmabaserad med frekventa resor till Kiev, Ukraina. Det är en visstidsanställning under projektets första sex månaders inledningsfas med en beräknad arbetsperiod på 30-35 dagar (kan justeras något uppåt). För denna tjänst krävs att du är bosatt i Sverige och har ett svenskt arbetstillstånd.
   

  

 Preliminär start i aug/sept 2024.
   

  

**Duties**
 The UCMP Expert plays a key role for the strengthening of SESU capacities focusing on processual, organisational and operational aspects of utilizing and working within UCPM. Expected work assignments are:
   

  

* Facilitate orientation of UCPM tools and processes and sharing of Swedish experience of utilizing them
* Contribute to an analysis of SESU’s current and desired capabilities in relation to UCPM.
* Support the development of different capacities needed to make use of UCPM tools, through activities such as training, mentorship, exchanges
* Plan and design learning and exchange activities
* Support Ukraine’s participation within the UCPM framework
* Contribute to the development of the project’s activity plan and results framework
* Coordinate with partner organisation and MSB project’s staff
* Consolidate documentation and reporting from project activities
* Contribute to identifying and communicating relevant learnings from the Ukraine experience back to MSB.
* Other work assignments might be discussed as/if required.


**Qualifications**
**Experience**
* At least 5 years relevant professional experience, in the field of Disaster Risk Management and Crisis Response or similar fields, of which a minimum of 3 years are relevant operational experience at strategic level with responsibility of project implementation and results fulfilment, including planning and coordination
* Good understanding of the EU and the UCPM
* Demonstrated experience of working with UCPM tools and processes
* Experience of planning and facilitating learning activities


 Merits:
   

  

* Experience of implementation/coordination of capacity development programmes or similar
* Understanding of integrating of cross-cutting issues, such as gender equality, human rights and environmental perspectives into programme implementation
* Good understanding of the Swedish experience of UCPM membership
* Working experience in Ukraine or the nearby region


**Education**
* University degree in social science, civil protection, disaster risk management or another relevant field. A combination of other academic merits with several years of relevant professional experience could be seen as equivalent.
* Specific courses and trainings in UCPM, organisational development and change management studies are an asset.


 Driving license class B is mandatory.
   

  

**Languages**
* Proficiency written and spoken English is a mandatory requirement.
* Ukrainian and/or Russian is desirable


**Other Requirements**
 We are looking for persons with a strong commitment towards international cooperation. It is of utmost priority that you understand, respect and act in the spirit of the mandate and core values of the MSB. Before a registration on MSB's roster, you need to fill in a self-assessed health declaration. If recruited for an international mission, you also need to undergo a health examination before departure. You must inform your regular employer of your potential assignment with the MSB. MSB operations are based on the needs of populations affected by crisis, and human equality. Through my behaviour and work as MSB field staff, I actively strive to prevent discrimination and harassment based on sex, ethnic origin, age, religion or belief, political opinion, disability, sexual orientation and gender identity or expression.
   

  

**Profile**
* You have strong communicative and interpersonal skills, ability to act with tact and diplomacy, open-minded approach, and respect towards cultural differences.
* You have the ability to work independently and as a part of a team, also under stressful circumstances.
* You have strong analytical skills as well as practical “hands-on” approach to addressing tasks.


 We place great emphasis on personal qualities and suitability in this recruitment process.
   

  

**Contractual conditions**
 Working with the MSB on international operations means that you are temporarily employed by the MSB. The MSB pays salary as well as a comprehensive allowances and benefits package to field staff on international operations, ranging from free home leave travel to access to psychosocial support. In addition, participants on induction training and relevant specialist training courses receive remuneration from the MSB.
   

  

 If selected for this position an evaluation will be done after the mission. The evaluation can result in an offer to be registered on the MSB roster. When you are registered on the MSB roster you can continuously receive interesting international job opportunities and invitations to stimulating and valuable trainings and exercises.
   

  

 A registration on MSB roster is valid for three years. After this period your registration will be evaluated and you may be offered an extended registration. After being registered on the roster you need to conduct the MSB induction training and any specialist training courses required.
   

  

 You’ll be employed one year at a time and before an extension of your employment we will perform an evaluation between Project Management, HR and you.
   

  

 HOW TO APPLY:
   

  

 MSB applies a policy of equal opportunities to avoid any form of discrimination. We strive for gender balance and qualified women are strongly encouraged to apply.
   

  

 If you wish to apply for the position please press the apply button and register your details on MyPages. Please note, the information provided on MyPages will form the basis for your CV. After registering on MyPages do not forget to apply for the position by submitting your application through MyPages.
   

  

 As applicant, it is your responsibility to document our skills in a way that allows an objective and qualitative assessment. MSB is a government agency subject to the principle of public access to official records. This means that if someone requests copies of application documents, we are obliged to disclose them.
   

  

 Please note that applications will be continuously reviewed when received up until the application deadline. Therefore, we encourage all candidates to submit their application as soon as possible.
   

  

 If you have any questions, please contact HR Officer:
   

  

 Amanda Jansson, phone +46 10 240 5446 or e-mail: amanda.jansson@msb.se
   

  

**Application deadline**
 2024-08-05
   

  

**Point of contact**
 Amanda Jansson
   

  

 Amanda.Jansson@msb.se
   

  

 +46102405446

title: F2F Fundraiser
description:
We are looking for you who want to take a step into a working life that makes a real difference. Your goal is to create engagement for Oxfam’s issues and tell the story of how we as a movement improve the lives of people worldwide. Through personal conversations, you create interest in Oxfam’s work and motivate people to give their first donation to us.
 



  





**Your Mission** 



* Recruit monthly donors from various neighborhoods. We use the successful Face to Face fundraising method, used by several humanitarian organizations across the world
* Work in a team of fantastic people, who want to create positive change in the lives of the world’s most underprivileged sections of the population
* Be Oxfam’s representative in Swedish society
* Positively influence people in Sweden about Oxfam’s work for people living in poverty and faced with natural calamities as well as conflicts in more than 90 countries in the world



  





**We offer** 



* A job where you make a difference for the people who need it the most
* Ongoing training in humanitarian work and human rights
* Ongoing training and coaching in leadership, fundraising techniques, sales, and communication
* An international and social environment for you to grow with others
* Salary 19 600 SEK/month for 30 hours of work/week



  





**We are looking for candidates who are** 
 :
 


* Driven, empathic, and positive
* Excellent verbal communicators and enjoys working in a team
* Able to express themselves freely in English and/or Swedish
* Motivated by result-oriented work
* Interested in contributing to a more equal future



  





 We see it as a plus if you have previous experience working in or volunteering for an organization, or from fundraising and sales.
 



  





**Application** 




 Apply by clicking on the button below. Last day to apply is 7 July 2024
 



 Questions about the job can be sent to Arash Aeineh arash.aeineh@oxfam.se.

title: Systemförvaltare FSM till Presto
description:
Brinner du för att hantera affärsprocesser och säkerställa optimal användning i Prestos koncerngemensamma Field Servie Manamgement system? Presto är inne på en spännande tillväxtresa där man rullar ut systemet i nya länder och söker dig som vill vara med och sätta din prägel. Missa inte chansen – ansök till rollen som Systemförvaltare FSM idag!
   

  

 Din vardag
   

  

 Som systemförvaltare FSM på Presto kommer du säkerställa att ITIL processer följs och vara delaktig i att förverkliga inkommande krav genom dialog med utvecklare och leverantörer. Du kommer att ansvara för att utföra och följa upp tester, hantera utgivningar och säkerställa att systemet fungerar optimalt. Prestos FSM, IFS är koncerngemensamt och du kommer ha kontakt med Prestos verksamheter både i Norden och Europa.
   

  

 Du kommer bland annat att:
   

  

* Stödja verksamheten i deras behov av utveckling i systemet
* Utveckla och underhålla systemdokumentation
* Upprätthålla och vidareutveckla processen för utrullning och migration
* Ansvara över att beställa förbättringar från leverantören


 Du kommer jobba nära övriga systemförvaltare i teamet och bli en del av Group IT samt rapportera till chefen för System Management. Vi sitter på helt nyrenoverande kontor centralt i Stockholm och delvist distansarbete är möjligt.
   

  

 Vem är du?
   

  

 Du har tidigare erfarenhet från liknande roll som gett god erfarenhet av Field Service Management system och dess processer samt en god förmåga att förstå affärsprocesser och snabbt kunna navigera mellan dem när det kommer till IT-lösningar. Du trivs i en föränderlig miljö och har lätt för att se och kunna föreslå effektiviseringar i befintliga lösningar i systemet.
   

  

 Krav:
   

  

* Relevant teknisk utbildning inom data/it eller motsvarande erfarenhet
* Tidigare erfarenhet från fältserviceverksamhet och FSM verktyg
* Ett par års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet som gett god förståelse för design och krav på integrationer samt applikationshantering
* God förståelse för ITIL-processer
* Svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


 Det är meriterande om du tidigare arbetat med IFS som FSM system och SQL kunskap.
   

  

 Om oss
   

  

 Presto AB grundades 1959 och är Europas ledande aktör med ett heltäckande erbjudande inom brandskydd, första hjälpen och säkerhetsutbildning. Vår vision är att tillsammans med våra kunder rädda liv. Som medarbetare på Presto gör du skillnad. Vi som jobbar på Presto har olika bakgrund och erfarenhet, men gemensamt för alla är en drivkraft att växa och att arbeta tillsammans som ett lag. Vi letar efter dig med rätt inställning och en ambition att utvecklas!
   

  

**Ansökan & kontakt**
 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Presto med Wise IT. Vill du veta mer om jobbet, kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult, Anja Widell på anja.widell@wiseit.se. Wise IT kan tyvärr inte ta emot ansökningar via mail, då vi värnar om din personliga integritet. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter.
   

  

 Urval sker löpande. Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: SAP Lead PP Consultant
description:
**At Vincit, we are known for building outstanding SAP solutions for our strategic customers. Hence, we're seeking a skilled SAP Lead PP Consultant to join our fun-loving bunch.**
**What is the job like, really?**
 You'll work with a team of experts in complex customer projects (both roll-out and support) and get to dive deep with your SAP module expertise in various development and maintenance tasks. Our SAP customer portfolio is broad and diverse so there's no need to worry about getting stuck or bored. Our projects can be demanding, but you'll be able handle that together with your future teammates as they are at the top of their game. You can find examples of software built by us and our public customer references on our website.
   

  

 You'll join a large and skillful crowd of SAP experts (over 150), but you'll also work extensively with the entire Vincit ecosystem – which means you'll get to bounce ideas and develop your own expertise with great minds.
   

  

**What are we looking for?**
 🎯 +5 years of experience in SAP PP module
   

  

 🎯 Hands-on experience in SAP system definition, implementation, and/or maintenance
   

  

 🎯 A systematic and brisk working approach
   

  

 🎯 Great teamwork skills
   

  

 🎯 Excellent communication skills in English
   

  

**Seen as an advantage**
 💯 Proficiency in communication: Finnish, Swedish, or Polish
   

  

 💯 Experience in IBP, QM, SD or MM modules
   

  

 💯 Experience in working in frontline with customers (e.g. presales, design)
   

  

 💯 Experience in S/4HANA
   

  

**Cool, but what's in it for me?**
 🌟
 **Maximal flexibility** 
**and location independence** 
 – set up your workstation wherever you want and utilize our awesome office spaces in the way you feel is most suitable for you
   

  

 🌟
 **Work-life balance** 
 – we encourage you to shape your work life according to your personal needs
   

  

 🌟
 **More than generous employee benefits** 
 – lunch benefit, free snacks and drinks, healthcare and dental care services, extensive insurance, childcare services, high-quality work equipment – the list goes on!
   

  

 🌟
 **Competitive salary** 
 – your monthly base salary will be based on your experience and expertise + you’ll naturally get to enjoy Vincit’s bonus model, personnel fund and transparent salary weeks
   

  

 🌟
 **Competence development** 
 – we have set up Univincity to support workplace learning in various ways
   

  

 🌟
 **Various career opportunities** 
 – pursue the role that's right for you, be it a new position, lateral move, or venturing into a different direction
   

  

 🌟
 **Modern, transparent, and humane organization culture –** 
 thanks to these traits, we're an award-winning workplace to be proud of
   

  

 🌟
 **Local and international work environment** 
 – enjoy the numerous activities and hobby clubs in your local community or explore an office exchange opportunity in our European or US locations
   

  

 🌟
 **A team of skilled experts at least equal to yourself** 
 – our way of working and thinking usually suits those who are, or want to be, at the top of their profession. Work with us and you get to be part of our Vincit community which consists of the country’s top developers, designers, and other experts.
   

  

**Curious but still on the fence?**
 To get to know us as an employer, we recommend checking our career site, blog, Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn.
   

  

 Please contact us as soon as possible. We will start contacting suitable candidates already within the application period.
   

  

*P.S. Please note that if you live abroad and want to work with us, we need you to have the necessary permits for working in Finland, Sweden or Poland.* 

  

  

  

 We’re a leading digital business agency committed to accelerating and transforming our clients' businesses without the fuss. We believe that technology is key to solving the global challenges of our time. Together, we can achieve amazing things by breaking the norms of work-life and offering the best possible environment, tools, and growth opportunities for our employees. We aim to create better Mondays—for our people, our clients, and our planet.
   

  

 Our community is made up of top professionals from a diverse range of IT fields, united by a passion for what digital tools, empathy, and sharp thinking can accomplish.
